verb.description: (of ice, snow, or another frozen substance, such as food) become liquid or soft as a result of warming.
examples: the river thawed and barges of food began to reach the capital

noun.description: A period of warmer weather that thaws ice and snow.

origin: Old English thawian (verb), of West Germanic origin; related to Dutch dooien. The noun (first recorded in Middle English) developed its figurative use in the mid 19th century.
